content: On the loan side, obviously, the loan growth was extremely strong in the quarter, excluding PPP loans, loans grew by $803 million in the quarter. Net interest margin, as Tom mentioned, loan growth, exclusive of PPP forgiveness was $803 million for the second quarter. So, we had net average loan growth of $542 million in the second quarter. Deposits decreased by $637 million in the second quarter, $532 million of this decrease related to correspondent banks. Loan loss provision, our provision increased by $4.2 million in the second quarter as our loan production, excluding PPP, increased by $314 million for the first quarter. First, salaries and benefits, as a result of our market expansions, total salaries increased by $732,000 in the second quarter and by $1.9 million year-over-year.
